issue.title: Add an exception for intellimize domains?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello, I noticed that the adguard-bot [identified](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907) intellimize.co spyware and added it to the list of [third party tracking servers](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c).

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://mail.yandex.ru/?uid=870573386#inbox](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.yandex.ru%2F%3Fuid%3D870573386%23inbox) ### Comment > Здравствуйте! Используя меню "Блокировать рекламу на этом сайте", скрываю 2 рекламных блока, отмеченных на скриншоте. Но ровно на следующий день реклама возвращается. Блокировал оба блока каждый день на протяжении нескольких месяцев, но что-то надоело этим заниматься и возник закономерный вопрос: почему такое происходит? Интересно с технической точки зрения. Предполагаю, что Яндекс таким образом борется с подобным ПО, но неужели вы не в силах блокировать вышеуказанную рекламу на постоянной основе? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/e0CGKDE.jpg)

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141393#issuecomment-1409898717 установите AdGuard Extra.

---

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.calm.android

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

_No response_

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Add an exception for intellimize domains?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello, I noticed that the adguard-bot [identified](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907) intellimize.co spyware and added it to the list of [third party tracking servers](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c).

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
> I noticed that the adguard-bot https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907 intellimize.co spyware and added it

AdGuard Bot is not AI to be able to visit a site by itself and detect something (ads, tracking, annoying elements).

> and added it

AdGuard Bot itself does not add, if you check more carefully, Alex-302 of the AdGuard Team approved it as a potential tracker: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c

As the form does not collect IP addresses it is unlikely we will ever know what kind of human reported it (or its own AI bot other than "AdGuard Bot").

---

To prove how simple is that "AdGuard Bot" you can use form report all broken pages:

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#report-issues

https://agrd.io/report

Only possible in that form add own github nickname:

 \> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35370833/215709460-0cb5c24d-7dd9-448e-9279-2f45a4ed5c7c.png)  | like in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141539
--- | ---


is not same like https://webcompat.com/ report form where possible use account to publish intead as anonymus simple bot ([webcompat-bot](https://github.com/webcompat-bot) - Mozilla Bot).

comment.body:
```adb
mobile.de#?#div#D_03_WALL:empty:upward(1)
mobile.de#?#div[id^="Mob_Brand"]:empty:upward(2)
```

?

I have no idea of a filter that uses CSS2.1 selectors only and "CSS4" can be converted to ExtendedCSS (JS) in Firefox and iOS anyway (Firefox have on experiment mode and on iOS maybe blocked by Apple API use CSS4 instead JS implementation of `:has(`).

issue.title: Releases pages on online.anidub.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

online.anidub.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, RU AdList - Counters, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

After enabling/disabling filters, I found that problems with `online.anidub.com` caused by `AdGuard Russian filter` when used by `uBlock Origin` with filters I checked above + 6 built-in uBlock filters.
This issue does NOT appear on root pages: online.anidub.com, online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing, online.anidub.com/anime_tv or online.anidub.com/dorama. It appears only on RELEASES pages (like https://online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing/11560-urusei-yatsura.html)
In uBlock AdGuard Russian filter marked as "external/user filter".

The problem: when `AdGuard Russian filter` enabled, all page content just disappeared, leaving a blank page with AniDub's menu panel at the top of the page.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Check without built in "RU AdList" if isn't correctly disabled (RU AdList - Counters is a diffrent list and they can't be added to do not lost power of websites where don't follow file itself to fix blocked ads/trackers in 24 hours after list was updated).

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
In my oragnization seemingly the biggest problem was reading the expiration date from WHOIS.

Apparently hawkeye reported 1 occurrence of a problem with regional (sub)domains - report seemingly closed as repaired.

Of course, I do not mean when the dates are hidden, for example, eu TLD domains.

Please add these rules:

to user rules.
These rules should unblock PDF/Print/Email buttons.

NoCoin Filter List

issue.title: online.anidub.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

online.anidub.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, RU AdList - Counters, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

After enabling/disabling filters, I found that problems with `online.anidub.com` caused by `AdGuard Russian filter` when used by `uBlock Origin` with filters I checked above + 6 built-in uBlock filters.
This issue does NOT appear on root pages: online.anidub.com, online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing, online.anidub.com/anime_tv or online.anidub.com/dorama. It appears only on RELEASES pages (like https://online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing/11560-urusei-yatsura.html)
In uBlock AdGuard Russian filter marked as "external/user filter".

The problem: when `AdGuard Russian filter` enabled, all page content just disappeared, leaving a blank page with AniDub's menu panel at the top of the page.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Fixed, update should be available in 1-2 hours.

comment.body:
Resolved by List-KR filter.
The patch will be available in up to 4 hours.
After that time, you can download it by clicking `Check for filter updates...` in AdGuard tray menu.

<details>
<summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

List-KR 필터에 의해 해결되었습니다.
패치는 최대 4시간안에 사용하실 수 있습니다.
최대 4시간이 지난 후에 AdGuard 트레이 메뉴에 있는 `필터 업데이트 확인...`을 클릭하여 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

## Prerequisites

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;

- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

</details>

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
Does generic element hiding rules include cookies and annoying pop-up?

Parimat soovides
Best Regards,
________________________________
From: Alex ***@***.***>
Sent: Tuesday, January 31, 2023 1:16:04 PM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: Bushido1 ***@***.***>; Author ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers (Issue #141490)


Filter size does not affect filtering performance.
Tens of thousands of generic element hiding rules can affect.
But sure we will remove dead domains.

@DandelionSprout<https://github.com/DandelionSprout>

There is https://github.com/funilrys/PyFunceble

I tested it, many false positives. Only one of the tools, the result of which should be checked against the other tools.

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141490#issuecomment-1410176265>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ACXBRQLMGR6ZQCOLORBIJCLWVDX7JANCNFSM6AAAAAAULROBCU>.
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>

issue.title: intellimize.co
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello, I noticed that the adguard-bot [identified](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907) intellimize.co spyware and added it to the list of [third party tracking servers](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c).

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
Is it possible to decrease the influence of generic element hiding 
rules file size to the website loading? So that adding such new rules 
and present rules will not affect performance?


On T, jaan 31 2023 at 04:07:39 -0800, Imre Kristoffer Eilertsen 
***@***.***> wrote:
>> I tested it, many false positives. Only one of the tools, the result 
>> of which should be checked against the other tools.
>> 
> Fair point, I suppose; although I faintly remember it as such that 
> false-dead detections dropped drastically around the spring of 2022, 
> after it began checking against WHOIS databases and such.
> 
>> Does generic element hiding rules include cookies and annoying 
>> pop-up?
>> 
> Depends on the list. Ones like /I Don't Care About Cookies/ and 
> /AdGuard Annoyances Filter/ specialises in that kind of stuff.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub 
> <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141490#issuecomment-1410235890>,

Oh yes, you are right. The mobile homepage is `www.mobile.de` as well. Totally missed that. As soon I search and click an offer, it's `m.mobile.de` again.
After removing `m.`, the mobile filter works as well, also on iPhone.

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
>I tested it, many false positives. Only one of the tools, the result of which should be checked against the other tools.

Fair point, I suppose; although I faintly remember it as such that false-dead detections dropped drastically around the spring of 2022, after it began checking against WHOIS databases and such.

>Does generic element hiding rules include cookies and annoying pop-up?

Depends on the list. Ones like *I Don't Care About Cookies* and *AdGuard Annoyances Filter* specialises in that kind of stuff.

pull_request.title: update #140995 pc.watch.impress.co.jp

pull_request.title: toptech360.com

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
IMO decrease/reduce is not possible without detect as not use something anymore on webpages in origin files.

As you have an idea of cutting out generic rules with something (e.g. `sed` in CLI), you can try to make a list without cosmetic generics and add as an optional list to addons(extensions)/apps what supports it (form hardrive or localhost url to avoid found free servers).

Also possible disable for few minutes use "AdGuard Annoyances"/"AdGuard Cookies"&"AdGuard Pop-ups" but this can gernerate FP e.g. lost network filtering where pages wait for blocked files/request and enough is surrogate from `redirect/`redirect-rule` to speedup problematic page.

As a poor test, you can see if this speeds up site loading on iOS/iPadOS and with the addon/extension for Safari on macOS:

```adb
@@*$ghide,important
```

For AdGuard, **but this also disable whole generic cosmetic rules form "AdGuard Base"** (~98% can be from forking EasyList https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/master/easylist/easylist_general_hide.txt = 19k lines vs ~500 generic rules by AdGuard Team in own files) to hide ads/placeholders&leftovers.

Whether this helps the page load faster **remains to be measured**, if the result is not good, then I recommend knocking down the rule.


---

In uBO is implemented option "Ignore generic cosmetic filters" in My Filters tab on Dashoard.

https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock/wiki/Dashboard:-Filter-lists#ignore-generic-cosmetic-filters

And is still active for Mobile Phones/Tablets (uBo don't check ARM CPU power or name if possible with pure JavaScript).

In uBo, the above AdGuard syntax rule is incorrect, to avoid bad use in this way:
```adb
!
! https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock/wiki/Static-filter-syntax#not-supported
! aka backdoor @@*$document for entire page exception
!
@@*$all,elemhide,important
!
! to disable use scriptlet as second "rule",
! due uBo don't use "jsinject" to disable scriptlets in network syntax of filters:
!
*#@#+js()
!
```
